intro: Capsella anglica, commonly known as mouse-ear or common mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It is an annual or biennial herb that typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm. The plant features small, inconspicuous yellow flowers that bloom from spring to summer, followed by distinctive triangular seed pods. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Capsella anglica is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
